item.title: Do Large Language Models Show Biases in Causal Learning? Insights from Contingency Judgment
item.description: arXiv:2510.13985v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Causal learning is the cognitive process of developing the capability of making causal inferences based on available information, often guided by normative principles. This process is prone to errors and biases, such as the illusion of causality, in w...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, prompt, model, reasoning, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: CodeEvolve: An open source evolutionary coding agent for algorithm discovery and optimization
item.description: arXiv:2510.14150v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this work, we introduce CodeEvolve, an open-source evolutionary coding agent that unites Large Language Models (LLMs) with genetic algorithms to solve complex computational problems. Our framework adapts powerful evolutionary concepts to the LLM do...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, prompt, model, arxiv, context window | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
